trans-unit.source: Get Started with Azure Mobile Engagement for iOS in Swift
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Azure Mobile Engagement for iOS in Swift

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Engagement with Analytics and Push Notifications for iOS Apps.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Engagement with Analytics and Push Notifications for iOS Apps.

trans-unit.source: Get Started with Azure Mobile Engagement for iOS Apps in Swift
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Azure Mobile Engagement for iOS Apps in Swift

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Engagement to understand your app usage and send push notifications to segmented users to an iOS application.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Engagement to understand your app usage and send push notifications to segmented users to an iOS application.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you create a blank iOS app that collects basic data and receives push notifications using Apple Push Notification System (APNS).
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you create a blank iOS app that collects basic data and receives push notifications using Apple Push Notification System (APNS).

trans-unit.source: When complete, you will be able to broadcast push notifications to all the devices or target specific users based on their devices properties.
trans-unit.target: When complete, you will be able to broadcast push notifications to all the devices or target specific users based on their devices properties.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario using Mobile Engagement.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario using Mobile Engagement.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to follow along with the next tutorial to see how to use Mobile Engagement to address specific users and groups of devices.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to follow along with the next tutorial to see how to use Mobile Engagement to address specific users and groups of devices.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: XCode, which you can install from your MAC App Store
trans-unit.target: XCode, which you can install from your MAC App Store

trans-unit.source: the [Mobile Engagement iOS SDK]
trans-unit.target: the [Mobile Engagement iOS SDK]

trans-unit.source: Push notification certificate (.p12) that you can obtain on your Apple Dev Center
trans-unit.target: Push notification certificate (.p12) that you can obtain on your Apple Dev Center

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Engagement tutorials for iOS apps.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Engagement tutorials for iOS apps.

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Engagement tutorials for iOS apps, and to complete it, you must have an active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Engagement tutorials for iOS apps, and to complete it, you must have an active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <html></html>Azure Free Trial<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <html></html>Azure Free Trial<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Setup Mobile Engagement for your app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Setup Mobile Engagement for your app

trans-unit.source: Log on to the Azure Management Portal, and then click +NEW at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the Azure Management Portal, and then click +NEW at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click on App Services, then Mobile Engagement, and then Create.
trans-unit.target: Click on App Services, then Mobile Engagement, and then Create.

trans-unit.source: In the popup that appears, enter the following information:
trans-unit.target: In the popup that appears, enter the following information:

trans-unit.source: Application Name: type the name of your application.
trans-unit.target: Application Name: type the name of your application.

trans-unit.source: Feel free to use any character.
trans-unit.target: Feel free to use any character.

trans-unit.source: Platform: Select the target platform (iOS) for the app (if your app targets multiple platforms, repeat this tutorial for each platform).
trans-unit.target: Platform: Select the target platform (iOS) for the app (if your app targets multiple platforms, repeat this tutorial for each platform).

trans-unit.source: Application Resource Name: This is the name by which this application will be accessible via APIs and URLs.
trans-unit.target: Application Resource Name: This is the name by which this application will be accessible via APIs and URLs.

trans-unit.source: You must only use conventional URL characters.
trans-unit.target: You must only use conventional URL characters.

trans-unit.source: The auto generated name should provide you a strong basis.
trans-unit.target: The auto generated name should provide you a strong basis.

trans-unit.source: You should also append the platform name to avoid any name clash as this name must be unique.
trans-unit.target: You should also append the platform name to avoid any name clash as this name must be unique.

trans-unit.source: Location: Select the data center where this app (and more importantly its Collection) will be hosted.
trans-unit.target: Location: Select the data center where this app (and more importantly its Collection) will be hosted.

trans-unit.source: Collection: If you have already created an application, select a previously created Collection, otherwise select New Collection.
trans-unit.target: Collection: If you have already created an application, select a previously created Collection, otherwise select New Collection.

trans-unit.source: Collection Name: This represents your group of applications.
trans-unit.target: Collection Name: This represents your group of applications.

trans-unit.source: It will also ensure all your apps are in a group that will allow aggregated calculations of metrics.
trans-unit.target: It will also ensure all your apps are in a group that will allow aggregated calculations of metrics.

trans-unit.source: You should use your company name or department here if applicable.
trans-unit.target: You should use your company name or department here if applicable.

trans-unit.source: Select the app you just created in the Applications tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the app you just created in the Applications tab.

trans-unit.source: Click on Connection Info in order to display the connection settings to put into your SDK integration in your mobile app.
trans-unit.target: Click on Connection Info in order to display the connection settings to put into your SDK integration in your mobile app.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Connection String - this is what you will need to identify this app in your Application code and connect with Mobile Engagement from your Phone App.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Connection String - this is what you will need to identify this app in your Application code and connect with Mobile Engagement from your Phone App.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Connecting your app to the Mobile Engagement backend
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Connecting your app to the Mobile Engagement backend

trans-unit.source: This tutorial presents a "basic integration" which is the minimal set required to collect data and send a push notification.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial presents a "basic integration" which is the minimal set required to collect data and send a push notification.

trans-unit.source: The complete integration documentation can be found in the [Mobile Engagement iOS SDK documentation]
trans-unit.target: The complete integration documentation can be found in the [Mobile Engagement iOS SDK documentation]

trans-unit.source: We will create a basic app with XCode to demonstrate the integration:
trans-unit.target: We will create a basic app with XCode to demonstrate the integration:

trans-unit.source: Create a new iOS project
trans-unit.target: Create a new iOS project

trans-unit.source: You may skip this step if you already have an app and are familiar with iOS development
trans-unit.target: You may skip this step if you already have an app and are familiar with iOS development

trans-unit.source: Launch Xcode and in the popup, select Create a new Xcode project
trans-unit.target: Launch Xcode and in the popup, select Create a new Xcode project

trans-unit.source: Select Single View Application and click Next
trans-unit.target: Select Single View Application and click Next

trans-unit.source: Fill in the Product Name, Organization Name and Organization Identifier.
trans-unit.target: Fill in the Product Name, Organization Name and Organization Identifier.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you have selected Swift in the language.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you have selected Swift in the language.

trans-unit.source: Xcode will create the demo app to which we will integrate Mobile Engagement
trans-unit.target: Xcode will create the demo app to which we will integrate Mobile Engagement

trans-unit.source: Connect your app to Mobile Engagement backend
trans-unit.target: Connect your app to Mobile Engagement backend

trans-unit.source: Download the [Mobile Engagement iOS SDK]
trans-unit.target: Download the [Mobile Engagement iOS SDK]

trans-unit.source: Extract the .tar.gz file to a folder in your computer
trans-unit.target: Extract the .tar.gz file to a folder in your computer

trans-unit.source: Right click the project and select "Add files to ..."
trans-unit.target: Right click the project and select "Add files to ..."

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the folder where you extracted the SDK and select the EngagementSDK folder then press OK.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the folder where you extracted the SDK and select the EngagementSDK folder then press OK.

trans-unit.source: Open the Build Phases tab and in the Link Binary With Libraries menu add the frameworks as shown below:
trans-unit.target: Open the Build Phases tab and in the Link Binary With Libraries menu add the frameworks as shown below:

trans-unit.source: Create a Bridging header to be able to use the SDK's Objective C APIs by choosing File > New > File > iOS > Source > Header File.
trans-unit.target: Create a Bridging header to be able to use the SDK's Objective C APIs by choosing File > New > File > iOS > Source > Header File.

trans-unit.source: Edit the bridging header file to expose AzME Objective-C code to your Swift code, add the following imports :
trans-unit.target: Edit the bridging header file to expose AzME Objective-C code to your Swift code, add the following imports :

trans-unit.source: Under Build Settings, make sure the Objective-C Bridging Header build setting under Swift Compiler - Code Generation has a path to this header.
trans-unit.target: Under Build Settings, make sure the Objective-C Bridging Header build setting under Swift Compiler - Code Generation has a path to this header.

trans-unit.source: Here is a path example: $(SRCROOT)/MySuperApp/MySuperApp-Bridging-Header.h (depending on the path)
trans-unit.target: Here is a path example: $(SRCROOT)/MySuperApp/MySuperApp-Bridging-Header.h (depending on the path)

trans-unit.source: Go back to the Azure portal in your app's Connection Info page and copy the Connection String
trans-unit.target: Go back to the Azure portal in your app's Connection Info page and copy the Connection String

trans-unit.source: Now paste the connection string in the didFinishLaunchingWithOptions delegate
trans-unit.target: Now paste the connection string in the didFinishLaunchingWithOptions delegate

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Enabling real-time monitoring
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Enabling real-time monitoring

trans-unit.source: In order to start sending data and ensuring the users are active, you must send at least one screen (Activity) to the Mobile Engagement backend.
trans-unit.target: In order to start sending data and ensuring the users are active, you must send at least one screen (Activity) to the Mobile Engagement backend.

trans-unit.source: Open the ViewController.h file, import EngagementViewController.h and replace the super class of the ViewController interface by EngagementViewController.
trans-unit.target: Open the ViewController.h file, import EngagementViewController.h and replace the super class of the ViewController interface by EngagementViewController.

trans-unit.source: Ensure your app is connected with realtime monitoring
trans-unit.target: Ensure your app is connected with realtime monitoring

trans-unit.source: This section shows you how to make sure your app connects to the Mobile Engagement backend by using Mobile Engagement's realtime monitoring feature.
trans-unit.target: This section shows you how to make sure your app connects to the Mobile Engagement backend by using Mobile Engagement's realtime monitoring feature.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your Mobile Engagement portal
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your Mobile Engagement portal

trans-unit.source: From your Azure portal, ensure you're in the app we're using for this project and then click on the "Engage" button at the bottom:
trans-unit.target: From your Azure portal, ensure you're in the app we're using for this project and then click on the "Engage" button at the bottom:

trans-unit.source: You will land in the settings page in your Engagement Portal for your app.
trans-unit.target: You will land in the settings page in your Engagement Portal for your app.

trans-unit.source: From there click on the "Monitor" tab:
trans-unit.target: From there click on the "Monitor" tab:

trans-unit.source: The monitor is ready to show you any device, in realtime, that will launch your app:
trans-unit.target: The monitor is ready to show you any device, in realtime, that will launch your app:

trans-unit.source: Back in Xcode, launch your app either in the simulator or in a connected device
trans-unit.target: Back in Xcode, launch your app either in the simulator or in a connected device

trans-unit.source: If it worked, you should now see one session in the monitor!
trans-unit.target: If it worked, you should now see one session in the monitor!

trans-unit.source: Congratulations! You succeeded the first step of this tutorial and have an app that connects to the Mobile Engagement backend, and that is already sending data
trans-unit.target: Congratulations! You succeeded the first step of this tutorial and have an app that connects to the Mobile Engagement backend, and that is already sending data

trans-unit.source: Clicking the Home button of the simulator will bring back the number of sessions in the monitor back to 0 as shown above
trans-unit.target: Clicking the Home button of the simulator will bring back the number of sessions in the monitor back to 0 as shown above

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Enabling Push Notifications and in-app messaging
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Enabling Push Notifications and in-app messaging

trans-unit.source: Mobile Engagement allows you to interact and REACH with your users with Push Notifications and In-app Messaging in the context of campaigns.
trans-unit.target: Mobile Engagement allows you to interact and REACH with your users with Push Notifications and In-app Messaging in the context of campaigns.

trans-unit.source: This module is called REACH in the Mobile Engagement portal.
trans-unit.target: This module is called REACH in the Mobile Engagement portal.

trans-unit.source: The following sections will setup your app to receive them.
trans-unit.target: The following sections will setup your app to receive them.

trans-unit.source: Enable your app to receive Silent Push Notifications
trans-unit.target: Enable your app to receive Silent Push Notifications

trans-unit.source: Add the Reach library to your project
trans-unit.target: Add the Reach library to your project

trans-unit.source: Right click your project
trans-unit.target: Right click your project

trans-unit.source: Select Add file to ...
trans-unit.target: Select Add file to ...

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the folder where you extracted the SDK
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the folder where you extracted the SDK

trans-unit.source: Select the EngagementReach folder
trans-unit.target: Select the EngagementReach folder

trans-unit.source: Click Add
trans-unit.target: Click Add

trans-unit.source: Edit the bridging header file to expose AzME Objective-C Reach headers, add the following imports :
trans-unit.target: Edit the bridging header file to expose AzME Objective-C Reach headers, add the following imports :

trans-unit.source: Modify your Application Delegate
trans-unit.target: Modify your Application Delegate

trans-unit.source: Inside the didFinishLaunchingWithOptions create a reach module and pass it to your existing Engagement initialization line:
trans-unit.target: Inside the didFinishLaunchingWithOptions create a reach module and pass it to your existing Engagement initialization line:

trans-unit.source: Enable your app to receive APNS Push Notifications
trans-unit.target: Enable your app to receive APNS Push Notifications

trans-unit.source: Add the following line to the didFinishLaunchingWithOptions method:
trans-unit.target: Add the following line to the didFinishLaunchingWithOptions method:

trans-unit.source: Add the didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken method as follows:
trans-unit.target: Add the didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken method as follows:

trans-unit.source: Add the didReceiveRemoteNotification:fetchCompletionHandler: method as follows:
trans-unit.target: Add the didReceiveRemoteNotification:fetchCompletionHandler: method as follows:

trans-unit.source: Grant access to your Push Certificate to Mobile Engagement
trans-unit.target: Grant access to your Push Certificate to Mobile Engagement

trans-unit.source: To allow Mobile Engagement to send Push Notifications on your behalf, you need to grant it access to your certificate.
trans-unit.target: To allow Mobile Engagement to send Push Notifications on your behalf, you need to grant it access to your certificate.

trans-unit.source: This is done by configuring and entering your certificate into the Mobile Engagement portal.
trans-unit.target: This is done by configuring and entering your certificate into the Mobile Engagement portal.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you obtain your .p12 certificate as explained in Apple's documentation.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you obtain your .p12 certificate as explained in Apple's documentation.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your Mobile Engagement portal.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your Mobile Engagement portal.

trans-unit.source: Ensure you're in the app we're using for this project and then click on the "Engage" button at the bottom:
trans-unit.target: Ensure you're in the app we're using for this project and then click on the "Engage" button at the bottom:

trans-unit.source: You will land in the settings page in your Engagement Portal.
trans-unit.target: You will land in the settings page in your Engagement Portal.

trans-unit.source: From there click on the "Native Push" section to upload your p12 certificate:
trans-unit.target: From there click on the "Native Push" section to upload your p12 certificate:

trans-unit.source: Select your p12, upload it and type your password:
trans-unit.target: Select your p12, upload it and type your password:

trans-unit.source: Now add your provisioning profile and build your app for a target device
trans-unit.target: Now add your provisioning profile and build your app for a target device

trans-unit.source: You're all set, now we will verify that you have correctly done this basic integration
trans-unit.target: You're all set, now we will verify that you have correctly done this basic integration

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Send a notification to your app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Send a notification to your app

trans-unit.source: We will now create a simple Push Notification campaign that will send a push to our app:
trans-unit.target: We will now create a simple Push Notification campaign that will send a push to our app:

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Reach tab in your Mobile Engagement portal
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Reach tab in your Mobile Engagement portal

trans-unit.source: click New Announcement to create your push campaign
trans-unit.target: click New Announcement to create your push campaign

trans-unit.source: Setup the first field of your campaign:
trans-unit.target: Setup the first field of your campaign:

trans-unit.source: Name your campaign with any name you wish
trans-unit.target: Name your campaign with any name you wish

trans-unit.source: Select the Delivery time as "Out of app only": this is the simple Apple push notification type that features some text.
trans-unit.target: Select the Delivery time as "Out of app only": this is the simple Apple push notification type that features some text.

trans-unit.source: In the notification text, type first the Title which will be the first line in the push
trans-unit.target: In the notification text, type first the Title which will be the first line in the push

trans-unit.source: Then type your message which will be the second line
trans-unit.target: Then type your message which will be the second line

trans-unit.source: Scroll down, and in the content section select "Notification only"
trans-unit.target: Scroll down, and in the content section select "Notification only"

trans-unit.source: You're done setting the most basic campaign possible, now scroll down again and create your campaign to save it!
trans-unit.target: You're done setting the most basic campaign possible, now scroll down again and create your campaign to save it!

trans-unit.source: Last step, Activate your campaign
trans-unit.target: Last step, Activate your campaign

trans-unit.source: You should see a push notification in your device!
trans-unit.target: You should see a push notification in your device!
